criterion: Provides specific and relevant exercises for someone in their 60s, considering age-related health concerns.
Incorrectly suggests that high-impact exercises are suitable for individuals in their 60s.
Asks the user about their specific health status before providing personalized exercise recommendations.
Uses technical terms and medical jargon, potentially confusing the user.
Provides general advice on exercise duration and frequency without considering individual health conditions.
Mentions grapefruit's potential interaction with blood pressure medication without specifying the exact medication.
Advises the user to consult their healthcare provider before starting an exercise program, considering their high blood pressure.
Incorrectly assumes that grapefruit is safe to eat with all blood pressure medications.
Explains the importance of gradual exercise progression and monitoring physical responses.
